name: asparagus seedling production, for planting | asparagus seedling, for planting | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15373/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 asparagus seedling (crown) raised in a nursery during one year. From an asparagus nursery of 1 ha, seedlings for 10 ha productive asparagus fields can be obtained, i.e. a total of 250'000 seedlings are obtained from 1 ha nursery. ;PEF-Quality: data quality rating (DQR) =1.17 (i.e. excellent quality). This dataset refers to an average situation; for specific situations exchanges might differ substantially due to site specific parameters

The activity starts with soil cultivation of the field where after an establishing phase of two years seelings will be harvested for 7 years.

The inventory includes all activites of an average year in the productive phase of an asparagus field, i.e. soil cultivation, pesticide application, fertilisation and harvesting (manually). Machine infrastructure including a shed for shelter and fuel use are also considered as well as transport on farm. Inputs of fertilisers, pesticides, irrigation water are included. Direct field emissions from crop production activities (e.g. fertiliser and pesticide use) and land use change are considered. Also regarded are the first two years of the non-productive phase, i.e.planting (manually), soil cultivation (plough), fertilisation (manure) and PE foil.
From a mint nursery of 1 ha, seedlings for 12.5 ha productive mint fields can be obtained, i.e. a total of 1'388'887.5 seedlings are obtained from 1 ha nursery. Transport from the nursery to the farm is not included.
The activity ends with harvesting asparagus seedlings (crowns).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/013:Plant propagation/0130:Plant propagation

processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Asparagus has a lifetime of 9 years and 7 years in the productive phase (2 years of establishment, non-productive phase) . The dataset regards an average year of the productive phase of the nursery including also the inventories of the two establishement years (non-productive phase). The nursery is irrigated with 4000 m3/ha is applied on 50% of the fields. This results in a total amount water of 2000 m3/ha. 
Data collection and direct field emissions follow the WFLDB Methodological Guidelines for the Life Cycle Inventory of Agricultural Products in the latest version, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Input data sources were categorised from level 0 (L0) to level (L4) as follows: L0 = estimate, proxy; L1 = statistical data (e.g. FAOSTAT); L2 = L1 adapted to crop or country; L3 = literature data or approved L1 L2 by experts; medium detailing (i.e. kg of total N-fertiliser); L4 = L3 data of high detailing (i.e. portion N-fertiliser types).In this dataset data were obtained for yield: L3; Fertilisers: L4; Pesticides: L4; Machinery: L4; Irrigation: L3. Detailed information about the sources used for data sampling can be taken from WFLDB 3.0 - Documentation, available at: (Report section: https://v30.ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Reference flow: Yield = 250000 seedlings/ha

The exchange has been updated from 'potassium chloride, as K2O' into 'potassium chloride' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.0006 kg by 1.5829 kg of 'potassium chloride' per kg of 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Gregory Roy, Ctifl, 2019) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Marc Lambert, Yara, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Fertiliser application' for L3 and L4 data  (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
Corresponds to 150.0 kg/ha

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of asparagus seedling, for planting is calculated to be circa 2.26E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'cyclic N-compound', 'dinitroaniline-compound', 'diphenylether-compound', 'dithiocarbamate-compound', 'nitrile-compound', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'triazine-compound, unspecified'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 4.53E-05 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

Calculated value: The total amount of water used for irrigation (Personal written communication, Gregory Roy, Ctifl, 2015) multiplied by the country-share of irrigation technique (Personal written communication, Gregory Roy, Ctifl, 2015). See supporting documentation 'WFLDB-Documentation.pdf' chapter 'Water use for irrigation' (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Total amount of irrigation: 4000 m3/ha*year. Only 50% of the fields are irrigated, leading to 2000 m3/ha*year on average at the country-level.

Heavy metal uptake can be excluded by setting the parameter heavyMetalUptakeSwitch to zero.
Calculated value - Freiermuth (2006). See 'WFLDB-Guidelines.pdf', available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports.

Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'asparagus seedling, for planting' is calculated to be circa 1.24E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'potassium chloride, as K2O'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 2.48E-03 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.

Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated based on literature values or expert estimation: The total amount of nutrient (Personal written communication, Gregory Roy, Ctifl, 2015) multiplied by the share of fertiliser type (Personal written communication, Marc Lambert, Yara, 2015). Corresponds to 55.0 kg/ha
